text.div:
NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
SOTT1Clinical 0..*BackboneElementThis is an abstract type.
Elements defined in Ancestors: @id, extension, modifierExtension
Surveillance & Outbreak Toolkit T1 Clinical
Instances of this logical model are not marked to be the target of a Reference
courseOfDisease 1..1BackboneElementCourse of Disease
symptomOnsetDate 1..1datedate of onset of symptoms*:____/____/______
presentedToHCFDate 0..1dateFor this episode, date first presented to health facility:___/___/_____
admitted 1..1codeCurrently admitted in health facility ?:
Binding: SOT Yes No (required)
admittedHCFName 0..1stringname:
outcome 1..1codeOutcome of illness* (circle):
Binding: Patient Clinical Course Outcome (required)
outcomeEvaluatedDate 1..1datedate outcome was evaluated:___/___/_____
outcomeDate 1..1datedate* of recovery, default or death:___/___/_____
sequelae 0..1codeSequelae after recovery
Binding: SOT Yes No (required)
specifySequelae 0..1stringSpecify sequelae
diseaseAdditionalInfo 0..1stringMore on course of disease
onSetType 0..1codeOnset:
fever 0..1codeHistory of fever
Binding: Yes No Unknown (required)
temperature 0..1QuantityTemperature (degrees):
chills 0..1codeChills
Binding: Yes No Unknown (required)
sweat 0..1codeProfuse sweating
Binding: Yes No Unknown (required)
intensePain 0..1codeIntense pain
Binding: Yes No Unknown (required)
headache 0..1codeHead pain
Binding: SOT Yes No (required)
musclePain 0..1codeMuscular pain
Binding: SOT Yes No (required)
chestPain 0..1codeChest pain
Binding: SOT Yes No (required)
abdominalPain 0..1codeAbdominal pain
Binding: SOT Yes No (required)
jointPain 0..1codeJoint pain
Binding: SOT Yes No (required)
otherSymptoms 0..1stringOther, specify
bleeding 0..1codeObserved abnormal bleeding
sunkenEyes 0..1codeDehydration (thirst, sunken eyes/skin pinch)
Binding: SOT Yes No (required)
shock 0..1codeSigns of shock
Binding: Yes No Unknown (required)
fatigue 0..1codeIntense fatique or weakness
Binding: SOT Yes No (required)
height 0..1QuantityHeight
weight 0..1QuantityWeight
otherSignsSymptoms 0..1stringOther signs and symptoms, specify
complains 0..1stringMain complains expressed by the patient
cardiology 0..1SOTT1ClinicalCardiologyCardiology
respiratory 0..1SOTT1ClinicalRespiratoryRespiratory
gastrointestinal 0..1SOTT1ClinicalGastroIntestinalGastrointestinal
neurology 0..1SOTT1ClinicalNeurologyNeurology
cutaneous 0..1SOTT1ClinicalCutaneousCutaneous
ENT 0..1SOTT1ClinicalENTEar Nose and Throat
urogynecology 0..1SOTT1UrogynecologyUrogynecology
comorbidity 0..1SOTT1ClinicalComorbidityComorbidity or underlying conditions
treatments 0..1SOTT1ClinicalTreatmentsTreatments
vaccination 0..1SOTT1ClinicalVaccinationVaccination

Documentation for this format

element.definition: Base definition for all elements that are defined inside a resource - but not those in a data type.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
element.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.requirements: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them

element.definition: date of first appearance of the signs or symptoms of the illness/disease.

element.short: For this episode, date first presented to health facility:___/___/_____
element.definition: date the case first presentated to health facility. Caution: review potential duplicate data capturing with Section 1 before inclusion.
Was the case hospitalized, admitted to a hospital or other health facility as an inpatient?
If case admitted, name of the health facility where the case was admitted.
Outcome of illness. Where possible, verify status after a suitable period of time [user defined] and update.
date if the case abandon, recover or died

element.short: date* of recovery, default or death:___/___/_____
element.definition: date if the case abandon, recover or died
Complications of disease. To be defined based on disease. Is there a pathological condition resulting from a previous disease, injury, therapy, or other trauma
Describe this pathological condition resulting from a previous disease, injury, therapy, or other trauma
Additional information about the development of the disease over time
Was the onset of the disease unexpected and sudden?
Subjective or self-reported fever or history of feeling feverish regardless of measured body temperature.
Subjective or self-reported fever or history of feeling feverish regardless of measured body temperature.

Indicate site(s) of intense pain: headaches (pain anywhere in the region of the head or neck), myalgia (abnormal pain in the muscles), arthralgia (abnormal pain in one or more joints), back pain, chest pain, general pain, other site
Stomach or abdominal pain or cramping, acute or chronic, localized or diffuse pain in the abdominal cavity.
If bleeding reported or observed, indicate site of abnormal bleeding: gums, mouth, nose, vomit, stool, urine, vagina, at or from injection sites.
Intense fatigue, an abnormal state of drowsiness (lethargy or feeling lethargic), cannot conduct daily activity, lack of strengh

element.short: Main complains expressed by the patient
